name: Salna - Hotel style
ingredients: [{"name": "garam masala", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "turmeric powder", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "mutton masala", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "fennel seeds", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "cumin powder", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "chili powder", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "coriander powder", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "pepper powder", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "ginger paste", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "garlic paste", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "tomato", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "onions", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "green chilies", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "mint leaves", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "coriander leaves", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "bay leaves", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "cardamom", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "cinnamon", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "cloves", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "kalpasi", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "star anise", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "roasted gram", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "peanuts", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "coconut", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "fennel seeds", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "oil", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}]
instructions:
* Prepare the Paste:

   * Combine roasted gram (pottukadalai), peanuts, coconut, cardamom, star anise, a small piece of cinnamon, kalpasi, two cloves, and a little fennel seeds in a blender.

   * Grind these ingredients into a smooth paste.

 * Sauté Aromatics:

   * Heat 150 ml of oil in a large pot.

   * Add two bay leaves, two cloves, two small pieces of cinnamon, a small amount of kalpasi, a small piece of star anise, and four cloves to the hot oil.

   * Add 200 grams of sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.

   * Add one spoon of garlic paste and one spoon of ginger paste, then mix well.

   * Add six green chilies and continue to sauté.

 * Add Spices and Tomatoes:

   * Add half a spoon of turmeric powder, two spoons of chili powder, two spoons of cumin powder, one spoon of coriander powder, two spoons of mutton masala, and one spoon of garam masala.

   * Mix the spices thoroughly with the sautéed ingredients.

   * Add five chopped tomatoes and mix until they soften.

   * Add a little water and salt to taste.

   * Add a small bunch of coriander leaves and a slightly larger amount of mint leaves.

   * Continue to cook until the tomatoes are well mashed and the oil separates.

 * Incorporate the Ground Paste and Finish:

   * Add the previously ground paste to the pot and mix it in.

   * Pour in about 3 liters of water.

   * Check the salt level and adjust if needed.

   * Cover the pot and let it boil for about 10 minutes.

   * Once cooked, garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Overnight rice
instructions: Soak rice overnight.

name: Celery soup

name: Mediterranean Lentil & Chickpea salad
ingredients: [{"name": "- 1 can (400g) chickpeas", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "drained and rinsed- 1 cup cooked green or brown lentils (canned is fine)- 1 red bell pepper", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "diced- 1/2 red onion", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "finely sliced- 100g baby spinach (high in iron)- 100g feta cheese", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "crumbled (optional", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "for extra protein)- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil- 1 lemon", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}, {"name": "juiced- 2 teaspoons dried oregano- salt and pepper to taste", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}]
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, lentils, bell pepper, and red onion.

2. Add the baby spinach and gently toss together.

3. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.

4. Pour the dressing over the salad and mix well.

5. Top with crumbled feta cheese if using.

6. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 24 hours (the flavors will develop nicely).

In a pan, add some butter and chopped onions. Fry until brown and add ginger garlic paste. Once cooked, add all masala and cook for some more time. Add butter. Then tomatoes. Once cooked, add mashed veggies. Cook till it becomes dry and brown. Serve with butter, lemon, chopped raw onions and chaat masala on top.

Top it on toast. Add lettuce if required.

name: Hearty Lentil & Sweet Potato Shepherd's pie
ingredients:
[{"name": "1 tbsp olive oil
1 large onion
2 carrots
2 celery sticks
2 cloves garlic
200g brown or green lentils
400g can of chopped tomatoes
500ml vegetable stock
1 tsp dried rosemary or thyme
1 tbsp soy sauce
salt
pepper. Topping: 750g sweet potatoes
2 tbsp milk (or unsweetened soya milk)
1 tbsp olive oil or butter.", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}]
instructions:
1. Boil the sweet potatoes until tender, then mash with milk and oil/butter. 
2. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened. Add garlic. 
3. Stir in the rinsed lentils, chopped tomatoes, vegetable stock, herbs, and soy sauce. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender. 
4. Preheat oven to 200°C. 
5. Spoon the lentil mixture into an ovenproof dish and top with the mashed sweet potato. 
6. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown. Serve with steamed green vegetables.

name: Tofu & Black Bean Burrito Bowl
ingredients:
[{"name": "Shared Base: 
150g brown rice
400g can black beans
150g sweetcorn
1 head romaine lettuce
1 large avocado
150g tomato salsa
2 tbsp plain greek yogurt
fresh coriander
lime wedges. 
For 'H' (Vegetarian): 150g firm tofu
1 tsp smoked paprika
1/2 tsp cumin powder
1 tbsp olive oil. 
For 'M' (Omnivore): 150g chicken breast
1 tsp smoked paprika
1/2 tsp cumin powder
1 tbsp olive oil.", "quantity": 50, "serving_unit": "g"}]
instructions:
1. Prepare the protein. In separate bowls, toss the tofu and the chicken with their respective seasonings. 
2. Cook the chicken strips until golden and cooked through. Pan-fry the tofu cubes until golden and crisp. 
3. Assemble the bowls. Divide the cooked brown rice between two bowls. Arrange the shared ingredients around the rice. 
4. Top the vegetarian bowl with the crispy tofu and the omnivore bowl with the grilled chicken. 
5. Finish each bowl with salsa, Greek yogurt, coriander, and a squeeze of lime.
